- [x] Verify that the copilot-instructions.md file in the .github directory is created.
- [x] Clarify Project Requirements
  - Project type: Vite website project
  - Framework: React with TypeScript
  - Deployment target: Netlify
  - Purpose: Personal website practice project

- [x] Scaffold the Project
  - Project scaffolded with `npx create-vite@latest . --template react-ts`
  - All project files and dependencies created

- [ ] Customize the Project
  - Example components and styling can be added as needed
  - Replace starter content with personal website content

- [ ] Install Required Extensions
  - No additional extensions required beyond VS Code defaults

- [ ] Compile the Project
  - Note: Current environment has Node.js v18.12.1, but Vite requires v20.19+ or v22.12+
  - Upgrade Node.js to v20.19.0 or later before running dev/build commands
  - After upgrading Node.js, run: `npm install` to ensure dependencies are properly built

- [ ] Create and Run Task
  - Ready to use `npm run dev` for development
  - Use `npm run build` for production builds
  - Will set up tasks.json for VS Code integration

- [ ] Launch the Project
  - Once Node.js is upgraded, run `npm run dev` to start the development server
  - Dev server will run on http://localhost:5173

- [ ] Ensure Documentation is Complete
  - README.md exists and contains project information
  - netlify.toml configured for Netlify deployment
  - Project is ready for Git and GitHub setup
